According to the Dehkhoda Dictionary, the Akkadian word consists of the parts á¹­Ä«n meaning "mud" and nuro/nura meaning "fire" and is mentioned as early as in the Akkadian Epic of Gilgamesh, cf. also Avestan tanÃ»ra and Pahlavi tanÃ»r. entries.meaning: A cylindrical clay oven used, in the cuisine of the Caucasus, Middle East, and Indian subcontinent, to make flat bread, or to cook meat.
